paper_abstract: This paper is concerned with the problem of synchronization of discrete-time neural networks with time-delays under unreliable communication links, which are modeled as stochastic dropouts. The process of missing data satisfies a discrete-time Markov chain with two state components. By using Lyapunov functional approach, some delay-dependent synchronization criteria are first obtained and formulated in the form of linear matrix inequalities (LMIs). Then, sufficient conditions on the existence of feedback controllers are derived by employing these newly obtained synchronization criteria. The controller gains can be achieved by solving a set of LMIs. Finally, a numerical example is given to illustrate the effectiveness of the design method. (C) 2013 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Synchronization of discrete-time neural networks with time delays subject to missing data
